question: 1 (c)
statement_html:
A calcium channel in a cardiac muscle cell opens and closes in a random manner. Before receiving a signal for contraction, the channel is closed. The channel opens t milliseconds after the signal is received where t has a probability density given by \(\displaystyle p(t) = \frac{1}{50}e^{-t/50}\) for \(\displaystyle 0 < t < \infty\). Which of the following gives the expected time at which the channel opens?

i. \(\displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}e^{-t/50}\,dt\)

ii. \(\displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}te^{-t/50}\,dt\)

iii. \(\displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}t^{2}e^{-t/50}\,dt\)

iv. \(\displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}(t-50)^{2}e^{-t/50}\,dt\)
statement_latex:
A calcium channel in a cardiac muscle cell opens and closes in a random
manner. Before receiving a signal for contraction, the channel is
closed. The channel opens \emph{t} milliseconds after the signal is
received where \emph{t} has a probability density given by
$\displaystyle p(t) = \frac{1}{50}e^{-t/50}$ for
$\displaystyle 0 < t < \infty$. Which of the following gives the
expected time at which the channel opens?

i. $\displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}e^{-t/50}\,dt$

ii. $\displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}te^{-t/50}\,dt$

iii. $\displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}t^{2}e^{-t/50}\,dt$

iv. $\displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}(t-50)^{2}e^{-t/50}\,dt$
statement_raw:
A calcium channel in a cardiac muscle cell opens and closes in a random manner. Before receiving a signal for contraction, the channel is closed. The channel opens ''t'' milliseconds after the signal is received where ''t'' has a probability density given by <math> \displaystyle p(t) = \frac{1}{50}e^{-t/50}</math> for <math> \displaystyle 0 < t < \infty</math>. Which of the following gives the expected time at which the channel opens?

i. <math> \displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}e^{-t/50}\,dt</math>

ii. <math> \displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}te^{-t/50}\,dt</math>

iii. <math> \displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}t^{2}e^{-t/50}\,dt</math>

iv. <math> \displaystyle \frac{1}{50}\int_{0}^{\infty}(t-50)^{2}e^{-t/50}\,dt</math>
